t: Babylon’s Idols and the True God
Bel*pn has bowed down, Nebo stoops over; Their*ln images are consigned*i to the beasts and the cattle. The*ln things that you carry are burdensome, A*ln load for the weary beast.*i
They*ln stooped over, they have bowed down together; They*ln could not rescue the burden, But*ln have themselves gone into captivity.
“Listen*ln to Me, O house of Jacob, And*ln all the remnant of the house of Israel, You*ln who have been borne by Me from birth And*ln have been carried from the womb;
Even*ln to your*i old age I will be the same, And*ln even to your*i graying years I will bear you!*i I*ln have done it,*i and I will carry you;*i And*ln I will bear you*i and I will deliver you.*i
“To*ln whom would you liken Me And*ln make Me equal and compare Me, That*ln we would be alike?
Those*ln who lavish gold from the purse And*ln weigh silver on the scale Hire*ln a goldsmith, and he makes it into*i a god; They*ln bow down, indeed they worship it.

They*ln lift it upon the shoulder and*i carry it; They*ln set it in its place and it stands there.*i It*ln does not move from its place. Though*ln one may cry to it, it cannot answer; It*ln cannot deliver him from his distress.
“Remember*ln this, and be assured; Recall*ln it to mind, you transgressors.
Remember*ln the former things long past, For*ln I am God, and there is no other; I*iln am*i God, and there is no one like Me,
Declaring*ln the end from the beginning, And*ln from ancient times things which have not been done, Saying,*ln ‘My purpose will be established, And*ln I will accomplish all My good pleasure’;
Calling*ln a bird of prey from the east, The*ln man of My purpose from a far country. Truly*ln I have spoken; truly I will bring it to pass. I*ln have planned it,*i surely*i I will do it.
“Listen*ln to Me, you stubborn-minded, Who*ln are far from righteousness.
I*ln bring near My righteousness, it is not far off; And*ln My salvation will not delay. And*ln I will grant salvation in Zion, And*iln My glory for Israel.
